result.execSummary:
The defendant Elwood Eugene Bennett Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Milwaukee Count Cases 15CM3086 and 15CF1039, but consecutive to any other sentence; release ONLY for inmate work assignments within the House of Correction and The Day Reporting Center, no other release privileges; with credit for 2 days (05-23-2015 to 05-24-2015) time served. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.

miscConds.notes:
- Restitution set at ZERO
- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Cash bail on deposit to apply. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered.

- Regularly participation in an HSED or GED program as determined appropriate by DOC 
- Maintain employment as determined appropriate by DOC.
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.

- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- No contact with Target at 2600 S. 108th Street, West Allis, WI.
- No contact with Kohl's at 9035 S. Howell Ave, Oak Creek, WI.

- Defendant to notify Department of Corrections agent of all prescriptions within 3 business days/72 hours of receiving prescription from medical professional.
- Fill all prescriptions at one pharmacy, unless otherwise approved by Department of Corrections Agent, and notify the Department of Corrections agent of the pharmacy used.
- Mental Health evaluation and any mental health treatment recommended by DOC.
- Court suggests Trauma Informed Mental Health Evaluation.

- Maintain Absolute Sobriety: No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.  
- Department of Corrections must conduct drug and alcohol testing at least 1 time per month for the first year of probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Elwood Eugene Bennett Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: CIVIL JUDGEMENT REQUESTED FORWARDED TO ALI. OS

Defendant Elwood Eugene Bennett in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Student Intern Carlos Pedraza under the supervision of Assistant District Attorney Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by the parties. 

AS TO COUNT 1:
Court ordered defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction concurrent with Milwaukee County Cases 15CM3086 and 15CF1039, but consecutive to any other sentence; release ONLY for inmate work assignments within the House of Correction and The Day Reporting Center, no other release privileges; with credit for 2 days (05-23-2015 to 05-24-2015) time served. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. 

COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed defendant on probation for 2 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety: No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.  
- Department of Corrections must conduct drug and alcohol testing at least 1 time per month for the first year of probation.
- Defendant to notify Department of Corrections agent of all prescriptions within 3 business days/72 hours of receiving prescription from medical professional.
- Fill all prescriptions at one pharmacy, unless otherwise approved by Department of Corrections Agent, and notify the Department of Corrections agent of the pharmacy used. 
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
- Regularly participation in an HSED or GED program as determined appropriate by DOC 
- Maintain employment as determined appropriate by DOC. 
- No contact with Target at 2600 S. 108th Street, West Allis, WI.
- No contact with Kohl's at 9035 S. Howell Ave, Oak Creek, WI. 
- Mental Health evaluation and any mental health treatment recommended by DOC.
- Court suggests Trauma Informed Mental Health Evaluation.
- Restitution set at ZERO
- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Cash bail on deposit to apply. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. 

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;

Defendant Elwood Eugene Bennett in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant waived rights and pled GUILTY.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.    Court ordered case adjourned for Sentencing in Branch 17.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 1, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Elwood Eugene Bennett in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Held off the record. Case set for projected plea hearing. Defense received a new offer and request an adjournment. Court will allow for final adjournment. Court notes cases to return to misdemeanor court if no resolution presented at next court date. Case set for projected plea and sentencing on 01-25-2016 at 8:30 am, branch 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Elwood Eugene Bennett and attorney Darryl Everett Smith appeared earlier in court.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Statements by defense counsel that defendant has a pending case set for plrojected guilty plea in Branch 17. Court will allow this case to be transferred to Branch 17 if Judge Stark is willing to accept jurisdiction.
  Plea hearing scheduled for January 12, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Elwood Eugene Bennett in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Danielle Chojnacki for Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is looking for a monitoring agency. Case adjourned for  DPA hearing.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for December 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Branch 17 in jury trial.  Case spun to Branch 7.

Defendant Elwood Eugene Bennett in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Case set for plea hearing. Case to tag along with 15CF1039 only for global resolution. Case adjourned for plea and sentencing 10-27-208 at 8:30 am.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Elwood Eugene Bennett in court with attorney Louis Epps on behalf of Darryl Smith.  Morgan Wilz appearing under the Student Practice Rules as supervised by Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Due to Justice Point Report, Court passed case to 1:30 pm.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Elwood Eugene Bennett in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Pretrial conference held. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Status conference scheduled for July 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Elwood Eugene Bennett in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Elwood Eugene Bennett in custody.  
Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Branch 46.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
